title: Any more typophile (esque) forums - but for web design??
content: Just wondering if anyone knows of forums similar to this one but for web design or UI design. And what I mean by similar to this one is, a forum with significantly talented professionals.
author: sativo

comments.content:
Nathan, you might find this is the kind of thing you're looking for:   
   
 [http://www.evolt.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221206/http:/www.evolt.org/)   
   
I read it when I need answers to questions. Novices to seasoned professionals are present.   
   
Jon

[http://www.alistapart.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221206/http:/www.alistapart.com/)   
   
Each article has a discussion linked to it.

CSS Only, but all the best peeps are there and the archives are a goldmine.   
   
 [http://www.css-discuss.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221206/http:/www.css-discuss.org/)

You might find something useful from:   
   
 [http://www.yayhooray.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221206/http:/www.yayhooray.com/)

This is a very high-brow web design list (not for the faint hearted!).   
 [http://www.webdesign-l.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221206/http:/www.webdesign-l.com/)

Eric Meyer's CSS information and resources:   
   
 [http://www.meyerweb.com/eric/css/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221206/http:/www.meyerweb.com/eric/css/)

The infamous wrench ape is always good for a dig.   
   
 [http://www.webmonkey.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221206/http:/www.webmonkey.com/)

I'm looking for something that focuses more on the design side of things rather than the technology (even though with flash and css there is a lot of overlap).   
   
The thing I love about the typophile forum is that there are a lot of well versed pros that I could have access to.   
   
I know of folks like Joshua Davis and the like in the web design world, but I'd like to know of other heros in this space. As well as be able to interact with them in a forum.   
   
Any such beast out there?   
   
Sativo

the aforementioned !yayhooray! is home to many who once dwelt among the greys of Joshua Davis's now defunct dreamless board...   
   
you'll have to wade through the chaos to find the gems, but if you stick to projects&design or technology, the signal to noise ratio is considerably higher.
